Context: George Brown College donated $250,000 to the Student Nutrition Access Program (SNAP) in 2021 and renewed its commitment with funding for 2022. SNAP delivered 88,000 pounds of food and 2,783 e-food hampers and emergency grocery cards last year. The college believes that students should not have to choose between buying textbooks and buying food. SNAP operates a food pantry and food hamper service and also provides a range of other services including events programming and community referrals. The program serves students at all three campuses. Contact the Student Association's Community Services Coordinator Ronnie Cruz for more information: [ask.george@georgebrown.ca](mailto:ask.george@georgebrown.ca) or visit studentassociation.ca/snap. For other college-related inquiries, call 416-415-2000 or TTY: 1-877-515-5559, or sign up for updates at the website.
